step1.sentence: She looked up the word "eloquent" in her dictionary before writing the opening of her speech.

step2.story: During the meeting, someone mentioned a city that Alex had never heard of. He quietly looked it up on his phone and found it was a small historic town in southern Portugal.

step3.story: When Mia visited her grandmother, she noticed an old photograph of a woman in a military uniform on the bookshelf. Her grandmother did not remember who the woman was. Mia decided to look it up using a family history website she had heard about. Three days later, she discovered the woman was a nurse who had served bravely during the Second World War.

meaning.literalMeaningKo: 사전, 인터넷, 목록 등에서 단어나 정보를 찾아보다.
meaning.realUsageKo: 모르는 단어나 정보를 사전이나 검색엔진으로 확인할 때 씁니다.
meaning.etymologyKo: look(보다)과 up(위로, 찾아서)이 결합하여 정보를 찾아 올려다보다에서 유래했으며, 지금은 검색한다는 뜻으로 씁니다.
meaning.nuanceKo: 모르는 정보를 적극적으로 탐색하는 행위를 나타내며, 디지털 검색과 전통적인 사전 찾기 모두에 씁니다.
meaning.shortExampleEn: Just look it up online if you're not sure about the answer.
